title: 103_s2493
content: The "Senior Citizen Housing Safety Act" is the short title of the Act. It focuses on ensuring safety in housing for senior citizens. The "Senior Citizen Housing Safety Act" amends the United States Housing Act of 1937 to impose limitations on occupancy in public housing designated for elderly families. This includes a new paragraph specifying occupancy limitations in projects for elderly families. The "Senior Citizen Housing Safety Act" imposes limitations on occupancy in public housing designated for elderly families, including restrictions on individuals with disabilities and a history of alcohol or drug use that may interfere with the safety and peaceful enjoyment of other tenants. The "Senior Citizen Housing Safety Act" restricts occupancy in public housing for elderly families based on alcohol or drug use that may disrupt the safety and peaceful enjoyment of other tenants. The Housing Act of 1937 is amended to include provisions for termination of tenancy for occupancy violations or providing false information. Additionally, the eviction standards for nonelderly tenants with drug or alcohol issues in public housing designated for elderly families are revised. The Housing Act of 1937 is amended to prevent eviction of tenants in public housing projects due to project designation or actions by the Secretary. Nonelderly tenants engaging in prohibited drug or alcohol activities in specified projects must be evicted after three instances.
